Metadata.Title: All Access Is Denied by Default
Metadata.DirectLink: All Access Is Denied by Default

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • Java

What to Check For

Verify that all access is denied by default.

Why

All access should be denied by default to make sure that only authorized users gain access to sensitive information.

How to Check

To verify that all access is denied by default:

  1. Identify available authorization functionality. Your application may have a custom authorization library or it may use access controls provided by the framework.

  2. Identify the access control configuration settings. Find where the available authorization functions are configured.

  3. Verify that access controls are configured to deny all access by default. Examine the configuration settings to make sure that access controls are set to deny all access by default.

How to Fix

To deny all access by default:

  1. Identify available authorization functionality. Your application may have a custom authorization library or it may use access controls provided by the framework.

  2. Configure access controls to deny all access by default. If your application uses a custom authorization library, please refer to its documentation for instructions on how to configure it to deny all access by default. If your application uses access controls provided by the platform, please refer to the platform documentation for instructions on how to configure it to deny all access by default.

Authorization Guidelines

  • Perform Role-based Security Checks
  • Require Authentication and Authorization for All Sensitive Pages
  • Make Authentication and Authorization Policies Configurable
  • Deny All Access by Default
  • Check Access Control Permissions When Referencing Objects
  • Use Indirect Object References
  • Partition the Application Between Public and Private Domains
  • Secure the Account Administration Functionality
  • Automatically Lock Inactive User Accounts
  • Consider Using JAAS for Authorization

Authorization Checklists

  • Role-based Security Checks Are Performed
  • Authentication and Authorization Are Required for All Sensitive Pages
  • Authentication and Authorization Policies Are Configurable
  • All Access Is Denied by Default
  • Access Control Permissions Are Checked When Referencing Objects
  • Indirect Object References Are Used
  • The Application Is Partitioned into Public and Private Domains
  • Account Administration Functionality Is Secured
  • Inactive User Accounts Are Automatically Locked
